topics.body:
Honestly I really wish touhou does become the next big thing; besides the obvious of my liking the series, I also want it to become the next big thing cause I've honestly gotten tired of all the shonen franchises being pushed out.

1990's: "well underground western anime/manga/etc fandom; the latest rad series just ended so let's find the latest far out(yes I am being sarcastic) series.  What do you guys want to bounce out of this joint school and grab a wicked soda with next?"
"Dragonball and shonen!"
"Groovy!"
2000's: "Wat up homeslice?  What my dog wanna go ride with now?"
"Evangelion, Naruto and other shonen!"
"*sound of pneumatic shocks bouncing the car up and down* baller!"
2010's: "Le l33t c00lios; Naruto is over, Evangelion is no longer crackalackin, DBZ is pretty much over; what sup@h l33t fr@nchise we gun go wit n0W?"
"MORE SHONEN!"



I would be happy if it were just something different to be honest.  It could be a mecha, comedy, harem, scifi or whatever; I would just be happy with something different for once cause shonen has been king for longer than most people on here have been alive.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54a202e563687227dc6f1200#post_54a202e563687227dc6f1200
I'm not saying that shonen is bad; rather it's been over thirty years for how long shonen has been popular.  Is it really that bad to suggest people expand their tastes beyond one particular genre?


To use a analogy imagine if a person *only* ever watched movies, tv shows and read books about super heroes; would it really be so terrible to try to get them to watch interstellar or such?  Would it really be that horrible and unspeakable to get them to try something new?
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body: My point is saying that that shonen is overdone is like saying _Young Adult_ is a genre.
topics.author: 4fde4618945b700aa0002fff
